channel.title: Tracing Persistent Identifiers
channel.description: Recent content on Tracing Persistent Identifiers

item.description: Welcome This is the home page of an NSF funded research project: EAGER: Tracing the Use of Research Resources Using Persistent Citable Identifiers (ID NSF144840)

item.title: Project Objectives
item.description: About the Project Research organizations, data repositories, and universities are beginning to assign persistent web-accessible identifiers to scientific resources. Assigning these persistent identifiers serves two crucial purposes. First, they are assumed to increase the traceability and reusability of scientific resources by allowing data sets, software, and other resources to be cited within the scientific literature. Second, without such traceability, it is difficult, if not impossible, to develop tools to measure the impact such resources have within the communities they belong to, or to understand the spread of that impact.

item.title: Project Outcomes
item.description: Papers Mayernik MS, Maull KE (2017) Assessing the uptake of persistent identifiers by research infrastructure users. PLoS ONE 12(4): e0175418. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0175418 Code Top level Github Repository | NSF Funded EAGER Project : NSF1448480 Tracing Persistent Identifers | https://git.io/vPnbB PLOS One paper code Github source code Jupyter Notebook Python document classifier code Github Jupyter Notebook Data Various data products were used in the development of this research.
